snippet: The economy added 96,000 jobs in August, well below expectations, raising the pressure on the White House and strengthening the argument for action by the Federal Reserve.
abstract: Labor Department reports that the unemployment rate fell to 8.1 percent in August, from 8.3 percent in July, even as employers eased up on hiring; nation added only 96,000 jobs, and lower unemployment rate largely reflects those who left the work force entirely; disappointing numbers present a fresh challenge to Pres Obama just two months before the election.
lead_paragraph: The economy added 96,000 jobs in August, well below expectations, raising the pressure on the White House and strengthening the argument for action by the Federal Reserve.

headline.main: Hiring Slows in U.S., Putting Pressure on Obama and Fed
headline.print_headline: Job Gains Slow, Posing Problem For Obama’s Bid
